bug.author: yaroslavvb
bug.summary: No way to delete project with no runs
bug.description:
Trying to delete a temporary org/project There are no runs in the project so the button "delete project" never shows up <denchmark-link:https://app.wandb.ai/testtest/test>https://app.wandb.ai/testtest/test</denchmark-link>
Also I don't see a way to delete org <denchmark-link:https://app.wandb.ai/testtest>https://app.wandb.ai/testtest</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.61. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/wandb/client>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

The empty project is a know issue, we working on a fix. Until then you can add a single run to the project and then delete it. We don't currently expose org deletion, you can remove yourself from the org by going to <denchmark-link:https://app.wandb.ai/teams/testtest>https://app.wandb.ai/teams/testtest</denchmark-link>
This seems to be fixed, I now see a delete option
I do not see a delete button for a sample project (or example project).
